column1: hzfthHBx,OSCP cheat sheet,alice_killer,Bash,Saturday 23rd of December 2023 05:31:41 AM CDT,"Help articles :
This is the best command to use:
If you wish to use autorecon, this is the command I would use to skip Nikto and I use dirsearch as the directory searching tool:
autorecon ‚Äî nmap-append=‚Äù ‚Äî min-rate=2000"" ‚Äî exclude-tags=‚Äùtop-100-udp-ports‚Äù ‚Äî exclude-tags nikto ‚Äî dirbuster.threads=40 ‚Äî dirbuster.tool=dirsearch -vv <IP>
you should google them ‚Äî for example if you see ‚ÄúGunicorn 20.0.4‚Äù running on HTTP, google that along with the word ‚Äúexploit‚Äù or ‚ÄúRCE‚Äù or ‚Äúgithub‚Äù.

If it‚Äôs a webpage showing a service and version, google that service to see that the default credentials are. I would often look in searchsploit or google ‚Äúservice + hacktricks‚Äù, or ‚Äúservice + pentesting‚Äù or ‚Äúservice + hack the box‚Äù to see if anything would come back.
OSCP Chapter 8 (Introduction to Web Application Attacks), Chapter 9 (Common Web Application Attacks) and Chapter 10 (SQL Injection Attacks)

Assuming you probably see port 80, 8000, 443 or some other 8XXX port etc, based on your nmap scans you should see the host name, don‚Äôt forget to add it to your /etc/hosts file. For example if your nmap scan happens to show: ‚Äú Location: https://msxx.host.name:8000/login‚Äù, don‚Äôt forget to add ‚Äúmsxx.host.name‚Äù in the hosts file. It can make a big difference when dir searching.
